verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of King <S%H4428><s%> Lemuel, <S%H3927><s%> the oracle <S%H9294><s%> which <S%H834><s%> his mother <S%H517><s%> taught <S%H3256><s%> him.
What, <S%H4100><s%> O my son <S%H1248><s%>? And what, <S%H4100><s%> O son <S%H1248><s%> of my womb <S%H990><s%>? And what, <S%H4100><s%> O son <S%H1248><s%> of my vows <S%H5088><s%>?
Do not give <S%H5414><s%> your strength <S%H2428><s%> to women, <S%H802><s%> Or your ways <S%H1870><s%> to that which destroys <S%H4229><s%> kings. <S%H4428><s%>

It is not for kings, <S%H4428><s%> O Lemuel, <S%H3927><s%> It is not for kings <S%H4428><s%> to drink <S%H7941><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> Or for rulers <S%H7336><s%> to desire <S%H9001><s%> strong <S%H7941><s%> drink, <S%H8354><s%>

Lest <S%H6435><s%> they drink <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> what is decreed, <S%H2710><s%> And pervert <S%H8132><s%> the rights <S%H1779><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the afflicted. <S%H1121><s%> <S%H6040><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> strong <S%H7941><s%> drink <S%H7941><s%> to him who is perishing, And wine <S%H6><s%> to him whose life <S%H3196><s%> is bitter. <S%H5315><s%>
Let him drink <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> his poverty, <S%H7389><s%> And remember <S%H2142><s%> his trouble <S%H5999><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more. <S%H5750><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> for the dumb, <S%H483><s%> For the rights <S%H1779><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the unfortunate. <S%H2475><s%> <S%H1121><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> judge <S%H8199><s%> righteously, <S%H6664><s%> And defend <S%H1777><s%> the rights <S%H1779><s%> of the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> and needy. <S%H34><s%>
An excellent <S%H2428><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can find <S%H4672><s%>? For her worth <S%H4377><s%> is far <S%H7350><s%> above <S%H4480><s%> jewels. <S%H6443><s%>
The heart <S%H3820><s%> of her husband <S%H1167><s%> trusts <S%H982><s%> in her, And he will have <S%H2637><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> lack <S%H2637><s%> of gain. <S%H7998><s%>
She does <S%H1580><s%> him good <S%H9185><s%> and not evil <S%H9563><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of her life. <S%H9132><s%>
She looks <S%H1875><s%> for wool <S%H6785><s%> and flax, <S%H6593><s%> And works <S%H6213><s%> with her hands <S%H3709><s%> in delight. <S%H2656><s%>
She is like merchant <S%H5503><s%> ships; <S%H591><s%> She brings <S%H935><s%> her food <S%H3899><s%> from afar. <S%H4801><s%>

She rises <S%H6965><s%> also while it is still <S%H5750><s%> night, <S%H3915><s%> And gives <S%H5414><s%> food <S%H2964><s%> to her household, <S%H1004><s%> And portions <S%H2706><s%> to her maidens. <S%H5291><s%>
She considers <S%H2161><s%> a field <S%H7704><s%> and buys <S%H3947><s%> it; From her earnings <S%H6529><s%> <S%H3709><s%> she plants <S%H5193><s%> a vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>
She girds <S%H2296><s%> herself <S%H4975><s%> with strength, <S%H5797><s%> And makes <S%H553><s%> her arms <S%H2220><s%> strong. <S%H553><s%>
She senses <S%H2938><s%> that her gain <S%H5504><s%> is good; <S%H2896><s%> Her lamp <S%H5216><s%> does not go <S%H3518><s%> out at night. <S%H3915><s%>
She stretches <S%H7971><s%> out her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the distaff, <S%H3601><s%> And her hands <S%H3709><s%> grasp <S%H8551><s%> the spindle. <S%H6418><s%>
She extends <S%H6566><s%> her hand <S%H3027><s%> to the poor; <S%H6041><s%> And she stretches <S%H7971><s%> out her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the needy. <S%H34><s%>
She is not afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the snow <S%H7950><s%> for her household, <S%H1004><s%> For all <S%H3605><s%> her household <S%H1004><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with scarlet. <S%H8144><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> coverings <S%H4765><s%> for herself; Her clothing <S%H3830><s%> is fine <S%H8336><s%> linen <S%H8336><s%> and purple. <S%H713><s%>
Her husband <S%H1167><s%> is known <S%H3045><s%> in the gates, <S%H8179><s%> When he sits <S%H3427><s%> among <S%H5973><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> linen <S%H5466><s%> garments <S%H5466><s%> and sells <S%H4376><s%> [them,] And supplies <S%H5414><s%> belts <S%H2290><s%> to the tradesmen. <S%H9211><s%>
Strength <S%H5797><s%> and dignity <S%H1926><s%> are her clothing, <S%H3830><s%> And she smiles <S%H7832><s%> at the future. <S%H314><s%> <S%H3117><s%>
She opens <S%H6605><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> in wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> And the teaching <S%H8451><s%> of kindness <S%H2617><s%> is on her tongue. <S%H3956><s%>
She looks <S%H6822><s%> well <S%H6822><s%> to the ways <S%H1979><s%> of her household, <S%H1004><s%> And does not eat <S%H398><s%> the bread <S%H3899><s%> of idleness. <S%H6104><s%>
Her children <S%H1121><s%> rise <S%H6965><s%> up and bless <S%H833><s%> her; Her husband <S%H1167><s%> [also,] and he praises <S%H1984><s%> her, [saying: ]
"Many <S%H7227><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%> have done <S%H6213><s%> nobly, <S%H2428><s%> But you excel <S%H5927><s%> them all. <S%H3605><s%>"

Charm <S%H2580><s%> is deceitful <S%H8267><s%> and beauty <S%H3308><s%> is vain, <S%H1892><s%> [But] a woman <S%H802><s%> who fears <S%H3372><s%> the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> she shall be praised. <S%H1984><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> her the product <S%H6529><s%> of her hands, <S%H3027><s%> And let her works <S%H4639><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> her in the gates. <S%H8179><s%>
